name: UITableViewDragDelegate
desc: The interface for initiating drags from a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, itemsForBeginning: UIDragSession, at: IndexPath) -> [UIDragItem]
items.desc: Provides the initial set of items (if any) to drag.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, itemsForAddingTo: UIDragSession, at: IndexPath, point: CGPoint) -> [UIDragItem]
items.desc: Adds the specified items to an existing drag session.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dragSessionWillBegin: UIDragSession)
items.desc: Signals the start of a drag operation involving content from the specified table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dragSessionDidEnd: UIDragSession)
items.desc: Signals the end of a drag operation involving content from the specified table view

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dragSessionIsRestrictedToDraggingApplication: UIDragSession) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the dragged content must be dropped in the same app.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dragSessionAllowsMoveOperation: UIDragSession) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether your app supports a move operation for the dragged content.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dragPreviewParametersForRowAt: IndexPath) -> UIDragPreviewParameters?
items.desc: Returns custom information about how to display the row at the specified location during the drag.
